poem:
### In Front of a Rembrandt

In the hush of a gallery room,  
Paul Kelly stood,  
his heart a rhythmic ticking  
among the thick oils,  
the shadows pooling to meet him.  
Amid joy and loss,  
he saw clearly in the silent strokes—  
love's haunting silhouette,  
an echo of the ancient ache,  
etched into canvas and breath.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "In silence, Paul Kelly finds the beauty in the joy and heartache of our everyday lives | Joseph Earp We’ve all been heartbroken; we’ve all experienced love and loss. These things are not new and merely writing them down, or singing about them, does not hold any inherent worth. In 2001, storied Australian musician Paul Kelly found himself in front of a painting. It was a late period Rembrandt – a shadow-swathed portrait of the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
